intro: Diphaca pervilleana, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a hairy texture. Diphaca pervilleana thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests and alpine meadows.
